title: The Two Witnesses
shortSummary: Revelation 11 reveals the prophetic ministry and martyrdom of two witnesses who testify boldly for God during a time of great tribulation. Their resurrection and ascension to heaven signal God's ultimate victory, culminating in the sounding of the seventh trumpet and the declaration of Christ’s eternal reign.
timeline: c. AD 95 - The apostolic era, during the early Christian persecution and prophetic revelation

keyCharacters.name: The Two Witnesses
keyCharacters.description: Prophetic figures empowered by God to prophesy for 1,260 days, performing miracles and bearing testimony before being killed and resurrected.

keyCharacters.name: The Beast from the Bottomless Pit
keyCharacters.description: A demonic adversary who wages war against the two witnesses and kills them, representing opposition to God's prophetic message.

keyCharacters.name: The Seventh Angel
keyCharacters.description: The angel who sounds the seventh trumpet, announcing the kingdom of God and Christ’s eternal reign.

keyCharacters.name: The Four and Twenty Elders
keyCharacters.description: Heavenly representatives who worship God and acknowledge His sovereign power following the seventh trumpet.

definitions.definition: A measuring rod used in biblical times to measure length or height, symbolizing divine measurement and judgment.
A coarse fabric worn as a sign of mourning, repentance, or humility, indicating the witnesses’ solemn prophetic role.
A deep abyss or prison for demonic forces, symbolizing the source of evil opposition against God's people.
An expression of impending judgment or calamity, marking the progression of divine judgments in Revelation.

outline.heading: Measuring the Temple and the Holy City
outline.description: John is instructed to measure the temple and altar, symbolizing God's protection over His people, while the outer court is given to the Gentiles who will trample the holy city for 42 months, indicating a period of persecution.

outline.heading: The Ministry and Power of the Two Witnesses
outline.description: God empowers two witnesses to prophesy for 1,260 days, performing miraculous signs and exercising authority over nature and plagues, demonstrating divine authority amid opposition.

outline.heading: The Death and Resurrection of the Witnesses
outline.description: The beast kills the witnesses, and their bodies lie exposed for three and a half days, but God raises them to life and they ascend to heaven, causing fear and awe among onlookers.

outline.heading: The Earthquake and the Worship in Heaven
outline.description: A great earthquake strikes, leading to widespread fear and praise of God; the second woe ends and the third woe approaches, as the seventh angel sounds the trumpet announcing God's eternal kingdom and judgment.

outline.heading: The Heavenly Temple and God’s Judgment Revealed
outline.description: The temple in heaven opens to reveal the ark of the covenant, accompanied by dramatic signs of God's presence and judgment, affirming His covenant faithfulness and sovereign power.

application: Stand firm in your witness for Christ, even in the face of opposition and persecution, trusting God’s power to sustain and vindicate you.
Recognize that God’s timing and judgment are perfect; be patient and faithful during seasons of trial, knowing that ultimate victory belongs to the Lord.
Engage in worship and thanksgiving regularly, acknowledging God’s sovereignty and the fulfillment of His promises.
Pray for boldness and spiritual authority to proclaim God’s truth clearly and powerfully in a world that often rejects it.

keyVerses.text: And I will give power unto my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred and threescore days, clothed in sackcloth.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God’s empowerment of faithful witnesses to proclaim His truth during a time of great trial.

keyVerses.text: And the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voices in heaven, saying, The kingdoms of this world are become the kingdoms of our Lord, and of his Christ; and he shall reign for ever and ever.
keyVerses.significance: This verse proclaims the ultimate triumph of Christ’s kingdom over all earthly powers, assuring believers of His eternal reign.

keyVerses.text: And after three days and an half the Spirit of life from God entered into them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell upon them which saw them.
keyVerses.significance: This verse demonstrates God’s power over death and His vindication of His faithful witnesses.
